title: Three Conditions for Continuity Visualized
description: An interactive MicroSim that helps students explain how each of the three continuity conditions (f(c) defined, limit exists, limit equals f(c)) corresponds to visual features of a function graph. Features five scenarios including continuous functions, holes, jumps, misplaced points, and vertical asymptotes.
creator: Dan McCreary
subject: Calculus
Continuity
Limits
AP Calculus
Mathematics Education
learning_objective: Students will explain how each of the three continuity conditions corresponds to visual features of a function graph.

controls.description: Five buttons (A-E) to select different discontinuity scenarios
Slider to move the target point c along the x-axis
Button to check continuity at the selected point c
Button to reset the condition checker
